definition:
A *supergroupoid* $(\mathcal{G},\gamma)$ is a groupoid $\mathcal{G}$
equipped with an *involutive automorphism*
$\gamma : Id \mathcal{G} \to Id \mathcal{G}$, that is,
$$\gamma \circ \gamma = Id \circ Id \mathcal{G}.$$

[9]{} Baez, J. 2006., (Preprint).

**Remark:** A supergroupoid is a particular example of a $``N=1''$
supercategory with all invertible morphisms and an involutive
automorphism $\gamma$.
